page.title: 06 THE QUEEN'S HEAD
page.content: The pub was built in the 17th century. Originally it was a private dwelling: then a coaching inn and finally converted to a pub earlier this century. Since then it has had several owners. The present owners are Mr and Mrs Whiteley. They took over in November 1984. The pub employs a part-time cleaner. About 80-90 customers visit the pub every day and they serve about 20 lunches. 2 deliveries of food are made each week. There is a lounge, a bar and a games room. In the games room there is a pool table, a dart board and slot machine games.
